title: Tails calls are not being emitted as such

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The following rust code should get tail calls:
```rust
pub fn moo() -> String {
    goo()
}

#[inline(never)]
pub fn goo() -> String {
    "https://".to_string()
}
```
Instead we get:
```assembly
example::moo:
        push    rbp
        mov     rbp, rsp
        push    rbx
        push    rax
        mov     rbx, rdi
        call    example::goo@PLT
        mov     rax, rbx
        add     rsp, 8
        pop     rbx
        pop     rbp
        ret

example::goo:
        push    rbp
        mov     rbp, rsp
        push    rbx
        push    rax
        mov     rbx, rdi
        lea     rsi, [rip + str.0]
        mov     edx, 8
        call    <alloc::string::String as core::convert::From<&'a str>>::from@PLT
        mov     rax, rbx
        add     rsp, 8
        pop     rbx
        pop     rbp
        ret

str.0:
        .ascii  "https://"
```
